physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Presence of recurrent urinary tract infections and perineal dermatitis; elevated white blood cell count without obvious signs of infection; asthma diagnosed at age 2, requiring bronchodilators and inhaled corticosteroids.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially elevated white blood cell count doubled within the first month of therapy but returned to normal within several weeks; recurring perineal dermatitis resolved during the first year; asthma symptoms worsened initially but improved in the second year, with no emergency hospital visits required since month 12 of therapy.
